channel.title: Dynamic IP?
channel.description:
Okay so let me get to a point to start at here:
-I am using Comcast Internet (that is my isp..) -They only supply dynamic ip's to their home customers -Interested in hosting a rsps for friends only
What alternatives are there? Is there a way to host a server with dynaic ip in any way? I am aware and all the tutorials I have read say you need static.

item.title: Dynamic IP?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:18, topic:520448”][quote author=Xa link=topic=638946.msg4307058#msg4307058 date=1370053608]

Hamachi is shitty and not worth the time.

Hamachi is easy and doesn’t take any time especially if it’s just for friend…

Takes longer then port forwarding if you don’t know what you’re doing.

Hamachi is as easy clicking a button and giving the channel info out. Just get a tutorial, portforwarding: Getting your gateway, getting default login, learning how to portforward, portforward. More steps to portforwarding…
[/quote]
I’m quite sure L&P can portforward. Plus, the default login never changes unless you manually change it.
Gateway takes like 5 second.

Hamachi takes time to download and install, you have to get your users to download and install, then give out the IP.[/quote]yeah I know how to portforward and all lol I was just getting information on the dynamic side of it thanks guys this can be closed

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic IP?
item.dc:creator: @Xa1 Xa
item.description:
@Xa1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:18, topic:520448”][quote author=Xa link=topic=638946.msg4307058#msg4307058 date=1370053608]

Hamachi is shitty and not worth the time.

Hamachi is easy and doesn’t take any time especially if it’s just for friend…

Takes longer then port forwarding if you don’t know what you’re doing.

Hamachi is as easy clicking a button and giving the channel info out. Just get a tutorial, portforwarding: Getting your gateway, getting default login, learning how to portforward, portforward. More steps to portforwarding…
[/quote]
I’m quite sure L&P can portforward. Plus, the default login never changes unless you manually change it.
Gateway takes like 5 second.

Hamachi takes time to download and install, you have to get your users to download and install, then give out the IP.[/quote]

It’s not hard…if it’s just for friends. Did you not get the point of this post in the first place. It’s for their friends. I don’t see how hard it is to tell your friends to get hamachi.

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic IP?
item.dc:creator: @Xa1 Xa
item.description:
@Xa1 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:520448”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=638946.msg4306919#msg4306919 date=1370023007]
Whats the problem? use no-ip duc
[/quote]hmm does no-ip work with dynamic? Almost certain that just renames the actual ip?

[hr]

[quote author=Xa link=topic=638946.msg4306946#msg4306946 date=1370027039]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=638946.msg4306918#msg4306918 date=1370022935]

Get a VPSc:?
[/quote]I am not interested in getting a vps if that’s what you attempted to say.

Again, this is for friends not for an actual server to make cash off of.

Well use Hamachi if it’s just for friends…I’m sure your friends can get into hamachi simple.
[/quote]does hamachi work with dynamic? o.0[/quote]
Hamachi has its own IP thing…

It’ll work for just a server with your friends.

Read full topic

item.title: Dynamic IP?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:520448”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=638946.msg4306957#msg4306957 date=1370030082]
Broham I’ve got static. I go with comcast.
this is what No-IP is for honestly.
[/quote]so if I am understanding you correctly…

-I can have a dynamic IP via comcast
-Port my router
-Port my firewall
-Use no-ip still to create a STATIC IP and have others connect via that?[/quote]
Set up a static it within the household (local IP 192.168.X.X)
Port forward as per normal.
Use No-IP to mask your IP. If it ever changes No-IP will see the change and update the IP of the mask.
Users never see an issue.

Read full topic
